Authors:
Yong-Zhong Lu, Qirui Li, Kevin D Hyde, Ji-Chuan KANG,
Lakmali S. Dissanayake, Milan C. Samarakoon, Peter E Mortimer
Title:
Morpho-molecular characterizations of two novel
amphisphaeriaceous species from Yunnan, China
Abstract:
Amphisphaeria yunnanensis sp. nov. and Lepteutypa
qujingensis sp. nov. are introduced in this study from dead twigs
collected from an evergreen broadleaf forest area in Yunnan Province,
China. Both species are characterized by immersed, subglobose ascomata
and overlapping uniseriate asci with multi-guttulate, fusiform, brown
ascospores. Amphisphaeria yunnanensis is distinguished among similar
taxa in having long and narrow ostiole and comparatively small fusiform
ascospores. Lepteutypa qujingensis is characterized by comparatively
small ascomata and ascospores. Based on LSU-ITS phylogeny and
macro-micro morphology, both species are placed in Amphisphaeriaceae.
Morphological comparisons of the accepted species in Amphisphaeria and
Lepteutypa are provided.
